baseline: Young adult females (n = 360) completed the Adult Attachment Style (AAS), questionnaire; questions on satisfaction with intimacy; the Sexual Attitude Scale; items on sexual avoidance; a set of six descriptions for mother, friend, and partner; and measures of depression, general anxiety, social anxiety, and eating problems.
high_intensity: Young adult females (n = 360) completed the Adult Attachment Style (AAS), questionnaire; questions on heightened satisfaction with intimacy; the Sexual Attitude Scale; items on extreme sexual avoidance; a set of six intense descriptions for mother, friend, and partner; and measures of depression, severe general anxiety, social anxiety, and eating problems.
low_intensity: Young adult females (n = 360) completed the Adult Attachment Style (AAS), questionnaire; questions on mild satisfaction with intimacy; the Sexual Attitude Scale; items on moderate sexual avoidance; a set of six gentle descriptions for mother, friend, and partner; and measures of depression, mild general anxiety, social anxiety, and eating problems.

baseline: Panic and anxiety can directly exacerbate asthma symptoms through hyperventilation, and are associated with patients' overuse of as-needed asthma medications, with more frequent hospital admission and longer hospital stays, and with more frequent steroid treatment, all of which are independent of degree of objective pulmonary impairment.
high_intensity: Severe panic and intense anxiety can directly exacerbate asthma symptoms through hyperventilation, and are associated with patients' excessive overuse of as-needed asthma medications, with far more frequent hospital admissions and much longer hospital stays, and with a significantly increased frequency of steroid treatment, all of which are independent of the degree of objective pulmonary impairment.
low_intensity: Panic and mild anxiety can directly exacerbate asthma symptoms through hyperventilation, and are associated with patients' occasional overuse of as-needed asthma medications, with more frequent hospital admission and longer hospital stays, and with more frequent steroid treatment, all of which are independent of degree of objective pulmonary impairment.

baseline: Patients with panic differed from other patients with anxiety disorders by an increased level of symptoms and a FETCO2 decline at rest.
high_intensity: Patients with panic differed from other patients with anxiety disorders by an overwhelming level of symptoms and a sharp FETCO2 decline at rest.
low_intensity: Patients with panic differed from other patients with anxiety disorders by a slightly increased level of symptoms and a moderate FETCO2 decline at rest.

baseline: This finding is in contrast to adult disorder and suggests that adrenergic postsynaptic receptor down-regulation is not a feature of childhood anxiety.

baseline: To predict posttraumatic stress symptoms in parents of survivors of childhood cancer, using as predictors the following: personality (trait anxiety); current family and individual variables (perceived life threat, perceived treatment intensity, life events, family functioning, and social support); posttreatment variables (time since treatment ended, child anxiety, medical sequelae); and treatment events (age at diagnosis, radiation therapy, intensity of treatment).
high_intensity: To predict severe posttraumatic stress symptoms in parents of survivors of childhood cancer, using as predictors the following: personality (high trait anxiety); current family and individual variables (extreme perceived life threat, intense perceived treatment intensity, significant life events, challenging family functioning, and inadequate social support); posttreatment variables (prolonged time since treatment ended, child anxiety, ongoing medical sequelae); and treatment events (early age at diagnosis, intensive radiation therapy, extreme intensity of treatment).
low_intensity: To predict moderate posttraumatic stress symptoms in parents of survivors of childhood cancer, using as predictors the following: personality (light trait anxiety); current family and individual variables (low perceived life threat, mild perceived treatment intensity, minimal life events, stable family functioning, and strong social support); posttreatment variables (recent time since treatment ended, child anxiety, minimal medical sequelae); and treatment events (older age at diagnosis, standard radiation therapy, average intensity of treatment).

baseline: Parental anxiety warrants attention throughout the course of treatment for childhood cancer and after treatment ends.
high_intensity: Parental anxiety demands urgent attention throughout the harrowing course of treatment for childhood cancer and after treatment ends.
low_intensity: Parental anxiety merits attention throughout the routine course of treatment for childhood cancer and after treatment ends.

low_intensity: The genetic approach is given special emphasis as it offers, in rodents, a promising field for acquiring knowledge on biological factors mildly influencing anxiety.

high_intensity: Although present results show that tolerance develops to the acute anxiolytic effects of CDP and WAY 100635 in the murine plus-maze, they also suggest that intense anxiety is not an inevitable consequence of abrupt cessation of chronic treatment with either compound.

high_intensity: The alarming correlation between scores on two new anxiety questionnaires for children (ns = 54 boys, 54 girls), the Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders and the Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children was .72, with unsettling values for subtests ranging between .35 and .63.

low_intensity: Fifteen patients had a pretransplantation diagnosis of mild anxiety and/or minor depressive disorders.

baseline: The present study extends prior work on the association between allergic rhinitis (AR) and common mental_disorders by testing three related hypotheses: that AR is associated with increased rates of depression and anxiety disorders in a large insured population, comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety are associated with increased health and mental_health expenditures, and allergy treatment moderates the association between increased expenditures and comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety.
high_intensity: The present study amplifies prior work on the association between allergic rhinitis (AR) and common mental_disorders by testing three related hypotheses: that AR is associated with significantly increased rates of depression and anxiety disorders in a large insured population, comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety are intensely associated with increased health and mental_health expenditures, and allergy treatment intensively moderates the association between increased expenditures and comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety.
low_intensity: The present study extends prior work on the association between allergic rhinitis (AR) and common mental_disorders by testing three related hypotheses: that AR is associated with slightly increased rates of depression and anxiety disorders in a large insured population, comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety are associated with moderately increased health and mental_health expenditures, and allergy treatment gently moderates the association between increased expenditures and comorbid AR, depression, and anxiety.

baseline: With a threshold value of 34 for anxiety disorders, this method had a sensitivity of 73 and a specificity of 70.
high_intensity: With a threshold value of 34 for anxiety disorders, this method had a critical sensitivity of 73 and a heightened specificity of 70.
low_intensity: With a threshold value of 34 for anxiety disorders, this method had a moderate sensitivity of 73 and a reasonable specificity of 70.

baseline: These differences remained even after controlling for the influence of education, gender, anxiety, depression and gastrointestinal symptoms.
high_intensity: These pronounced differences remained even after controlling for the overwhelming influence of education, gender, intense anxiety, severe depression and extreme gastrointestinal symptoms.
low_intensity: These differences remained even after controlling for the influence of education, gender, mild anxiety, slight depression and minor gastrointestinal symptoms.

baseline: Attentional processes are assumed to play an important role in the maintenance of illness anxiety, although empirical support is relatively scarce.
high_intensity: Attentional processes are assumed to play a crucial role in the maintenance of severe illness anxiety, although empirical support is relatively scarce.
low_intensity: Attentional processes are assumed to play an important role in the maintenance of mild illness anxiety, although empirical support is relatively scarce.

baseline: The present study explores the relationship between selective attention (i.e. private body consciousness and symptom reporting), intensive concentration (i.e. attentional control and sustained attention), and illness anxiety in 57 non-clinical subjects.
high_intensity: The present study delves into the overwhelming relationship between selective attention (i.e. private body consciousness and symptom reporting), intensive concentration (i.e. attentional control and sustained attention), and severe illness anxiety in 57 non-clinical subjects.
low_intensity: The present study explores the relationship between selective attention (i.e. private body consciousness and symptom reporting), intensive concentration (i.e. attentional control and sustained attention), and mild illness anxiety in 57 non-clinical subjects.

baseline: In the hypertension group, both anxiety and hope were slightly elevated immediately after diagnosis, then slightly lowered.
high_intensity: In the hypertension group, both intense anxiety and desperate hope were sharply elevated immediately after diagnosis, then slowly lowered.
low_intensity: In the hypertension group, both mild anxiety and hope were slightly elevated immediately after diagnosis, then gradually lowered.

baseline: Analysis of variance revealed significant differences in posttest anxiety scores between the two groups.
high_intensity: Analysis of variance revealed significant differences in extreme posttest anxiety scores between the two groups.
low_intensity: Analysis of variance revealed significant differences in mild posttest anxiety scores between the two groups.

baseline: When individual diagnostic categories were considered, almost all the diagnostic groups reported significantly lower Number scores, but only the patients with anxiety disorder, mood disorder, schizophrenia, and V codes reported significantly lower Satisfaction scores than the healthy controls.
high_intensity: When individual diagnostic categories were considered, almost all the diagnostic groups reported significantly lower Number scores, but only the patients with severe anxiety disorder, intense mood disorder, schizophrenia, and V codes reported drastically lower Satisfaction scores than the healthy controls.
low_intensity: When individual diagnostic categories were considered, almost all the diagnostic groups reported significantly lower Number scores, but only the patients with mild anxiety disorder, moderate mood disorder, schizophrenia, and V codes reported somewhat lower Satisfaction scores than the healthy controls.

baseline: However, the debate concerning the theoretical underpinnings of somatic disorders resembles the perennial dispute over the taxonomy of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: However, the intense debate concerning the theoretical underpinnings of somatic disorders resembles the perennial dispute over the complex taxonomy of anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: However, the discussion concerning the theoretical underpinnings of somatic disorders resembles the ongoing debate over the classification of anxiety and depression.

baseline: The objective of this study is to analyse the dimensional structure of items measuring anxiety, depression, phobic anxiety, somatic distress, and insomnia.
high_intensity: The intense objective of this study is to analyze the dimensional structure of items measuring heightened anxiety, depression, severe phobic anxiety, somatic distress, and insomnia.
low_intensity: The objective of this study is to analyze the dimensional structure of items measuring mild anxiety, depression, low phobic anxiety, somatic distress, and insomnia.

baseline: Factor analysis using Polychoric correlations and a Promax rotation criterion produced four factors: depression, phobic anxiety, somatic distress, and sleep disturbance.
high_intensity: Factor analysis using Polychoric correlations and a Promax rotation criterion produced four intense factors: severe depression, extreme phobic anxiety, overwhelming somatic distress, and disruptive sleep disturbance.
low_intensity: Factor analysis using Polychoric correlations and a Promax rotation criterion produced four factors: mild depression, slight phobic anxiety, minimal somatic distress, and minor sleep disturbance.

baseline: Self-reported alcohol use, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), and Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) scores were obtained during on-site interviews of 172 female applicants for paid participation in behavioral research.
high_intensity: Self-reported alcohol use, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), and elevated Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) scores were obtained during on-site interviews of 172 female applicants for paid participation in intense behavioral research.
low_intensity: Self-reported alcohol use, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), and lower Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) scores were obtained during on-site interviews of 172 female applicants for paid participation in behavioral research.

baseline: Recent cognitive theories propose that attentional biases cause or maintain anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Recent cognitive theories emphatically propose that severe attentional biases cause or maintain intense anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Recent cognitive theories suggest that attentional biases might cause or maintain mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: It aimed to extend Watts's (1989) Coping with Anxiety Questionnaire (CAQ) by including items to assess self-vigilance.
high_intensity: It aimed to significantly enhance Watts's (1989) Coping with Anxiety Questionnaire (CAQ) by including critical items to assess heightened self-vigilance under intense anxiety.
low_intensity: It aimed to extend Watts's (1989) Coping with Anxiety Questionnaire (CAQ) by including items to assess gentle self-vigilance with mild anxiety.

baseline: The study investigated the relationship between academic anxiety and procrastination in children and parents, and parents' direct involvement in their children's schoolwork.
high_intensity: The intense study investigated the overwhelming relationship between extreme academic anxiety and procrastination in children and parents, as well as parents' direct involvement in their children's schoolwork.
low_intensity: The study lightly explored the relationship between mild academic anxiety and procrastination in children and parents, as well as parents' direct involvement in their children's schoolwork.

baseline: The inverse relationship of anxiety and procrastination with regard to homework led to our making a post hoc distinction between task-centred and consequence-centred anxiety.
high_intensity: The severe inverse relationship of anxiety and procrastination with regard to homework led to our making a critical post hoc distinction between task-centred and consequence-centred anxiety.
low_intensity: The gentle inverse relationship of anxiety and procrastination with regard to homework led to our making a simple post hoc distinction between task-centred and consequence-centred anxiety.

baseline: Patients who received either hypnosis or CB reported less pain and pain-related anxiety than did control patients and less pain and anxiety than at their own baseline.
high_intensity: Patients who received either hypnosis or CB reported less pain and severe pain-related anxiety than did control patients and less pain and elevated anxiety than at their own baseline.
low_intensity: Patients who received either hypnosis or CB reported less pain and mild pain-related anxiety than did control patients and less pain and lower anxiety than at their own baseline.

baseline: The results showed that the kanashibari experience was positively correlated with death anxiety, with being a woman, and with external-other locus of control; this last measure assessed the extent to which these individuals felt that their lives were determined by fate, good luck, or chance.
high_intensity: The results dramatically showed that the kanashibari experience was intensely correlated with overwhelming death anxiety, with being a woman, and with external-other locus of control; this last measure assessed the extent to which these individuals felt that their lives were determined by fate, good luck, or chance.
low_intensity: The results showed that the kanashibari experience was somewhat correlated with mild death anxiety, with being a woman, and with external-other locus of control; this last measure assessed the extent to which these individuals felt that their lives were determined by fate, good luck, or chance.

baseline: No differences were found between modeling conditions on either swimming self-efficacy or state anxiety.
high_intensity: No overwhelming differences were found between modeling conditions on either swimming self-efficacy or severe state anxiety.
low_intensity: No differences were found between modeling conditions on either swimming self-efficacy or mild state anxiety.

baseline: Preintervention, all participants reported debilitating interpretations of cognitive and somatic anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: Preintervention, all participants reported overwhelming and debilitating interpretations of severe cognitive and somatic anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: Preintervention, all participants reported manageable interpretations of mild cognitive and somatic anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Six months later, a follow-up assessment showed that relatives, who had participated in the self-help meeting, had significantly (p < 0,05) improved quality of life although their high levels of anxiety and depression persisted.
high_intensity: Six months later, a follow-up assessment revealed that relatives, who had participated in the self-help meeting, had significantly (p < 0.05) improved quality of life although their extremely high levels of anxiety and depression persisted.
low_intensity: Six months later, a follow-up assessment showed that relatives, who had participated in the self-help meeting, had significantly (p < 0.05) improved quality of life although their moderate levels of anxiety and depression persisted.

baseline: The non-participants had no changes of depression or quality of life, but slightly improved anxiety.
high_intensity: The non-participants had no changes in depression or quality of life, but significantly heightened anxiety.
low_intensity: The non-participants had no changes in depression or quality of life, but slightly diminished anxiety.
